Pawn - Class in chess.pieces
This child class of the class ChessPiece represents a Pawn piece.
Pawn(Board, Color, ChessMatch) - Constructor for class chess.pieces.Pawn
creates the pawn chess piece, which is associated with a board and has a color besides having an dependency with a chess match
performChessMove(ChessPosition, ChessPosition) - Method in class chess.ChessMatch
contains all the logic of validating and moving a piece, in a chess move.
piece(int, int) - Method in class boardgame.Board
This method returns a piece belonging to the piece matrix associated with the board given a row and a column of the board.
piece(Position) - Method in class boardgame.Board
This method returns a piece belonging to the piece matrix associated with the board given a board position.
Piece - Class in boardgame
Class Piece is the root of the hierarchy of classes that represent the pieces of a chess game.
Piece(Board) - Constructor for class boardgame.Piece
Creates a piece that belongs to a board but is not yet placed on that board.
pieces - Variable in class boardgame.Board
 
piecesOnTheBoard - Variable in class chess.ChessMatch
 
placeNewPiece(char, int, ChessPiece) - Method in class chess.ChessMatch
Put a chess piece on the board using the chess coordinate system.
placePiece(Piece, Position) - Method in class boardgame.Board
Put a piece in a position of the pieces matrix belonging to the board.
position - Variable in class boardgame.Piece
 
Position - Class in boardgame
this is an auxiliary class, responsible for representing the position of a piece on the board.
Position(int, int) - Constructor for class boardgame.Position
generates a position that contains a row and a column (the representation of rows and columns are given by integers)
positionExists(int, int) - Method in class boardgame.Board
check if a certain position exists on the board or not given a row and a column
positionExists(Position) - Method in class boardgame.Board
check if a certain position exists on the board or not given a position
possibleMove(Position) - Method in class boardgame.Piece
determines whether it is possible for a piece to move to a specific position.
possibleMoves() - Method in class boardgame.Piece
determines the possible movements of a piece which will consist of an array of boolean values, where each boolean value will contain a possible move.

possibleMoves(ChessPosition) - Method in class chess.ChessMatch
It will capture an source position that will be entered by the user, which will be of a ChessPosition type.
printBoard(ChessPiece[][]) - Static method in class application.UI
prints on the terminal screen, the matrix of chess pieces passed as method parameter.
printBoard(ChessPiece[][], boolean[][]) - Static method in class application.UI
prints on the terminal screen, the matrix of chess pieces passed as method parameter, in addition to indication of the possible movements of the movement's source piece.
printCapturedPieces(List<ChessPiece>) - Static method in class application.UI
Prints the black and white pieces that were captured in the game.
printMatch(ChessMatch, List<ChessPiece>) - Static method in class application.UI
It will print the board through the UI.printBoard(ChessPiece[][]) method, the indicator of the pieces captured through the UI.printCapturedPieces(List) method and if there has not been a checkmate (and this will be checked using ChessMatch.getCheckMate()) it will print respectively through the ChessMatch.getTurn() and ChessMatch.getCheck() methods, a message that will say which player is the current turn and also warn if there is a check.
printPiece(ChessPiece, boolean) - Static method in class application.UI
prints a chess piece.
